bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, June 29, 1880

div1.p: Walter Reed requests and is granted a one-month extension to his leave of absence.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, June 29, 1880
div1.p:
Filed with 2909. A.C.P. 1880
Reed Walter,
Asst. Surg. U.S.A.
S.O. 146 PM, 5 July 2, 80.

Respectfully requests
an extension of one
month to leave of
Absence granted per
S.O. 124, A.G.O. June 5, 80.

By order Sec'y of war.
[unclear]
Adj. Genl.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, June 29, 1880
div1.opener:
Harrisonburg, Va
June 29th, 1880.
To the
Adjutant General, U.S.A.,
Washington, D.C.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to respectfully
request that an extension of one(1)
month to the leave of Absence granted
me per S.O. to 124 H'd'qrs of U.S. Army,
A.G.O. Washington, June 5th 1880.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully,
your obt. Servant. Walter Reed, Asst. Surg. U.S.A.
